title: Queens Depart Hotel On Condition
text:
16:19 CET Queens Depart Hotel On Condition By Daily Guide 
Embattled Black Queens have finally checked out from their M-Plaza Hotel base but on a condition DAILY GUIDE SPORTS has gathered. 
The team vacated the Hotel facility yesterday few hours after receiving $5,000 each following a directive from President Mahama after the Youth and Sports Ministry has failed to resolve the gold medalists' row. 
The $5,000 comes nowhere near their $23,000 each owed them by the state, which should have made them continue their stay in the hotel as planned. 
But skipper of the side Mercy Myles has said before departing that, they left on condition that the directive came from none other than the first gentleman of the land-John Mahama, who they believe will honour his words. 
The fluent speaking skipper said 'Promises have been made which is not coming from any person than the President. 
'We are ok with it and will leave the hotel immediately believing that the president will not let us down.' 
She pointed out that her mates were happy with the president's assurance in payment of their outstanding bonus on his return from the United States where he is attending a UN General Assembly. 
The coach Yusif Basigi girls rejected an initial $2,000 thrown at them by the Youth and Sports Ministry and threatened to stay at the Hotel till they receive all outstanding bonuses-$12,000 being monies they made during the Congo Brazzaville Games and $11,000 which was an accrued arrears since 2012. 
Marketing Executive at M-Plaza Hotel, Eva Love Mensah, confirmed that the team had checked out. 
By Kofi Owusu Aduonum
